citations.narrative:
The current records of animals on hand do not accurately reflect the animals at the facility. The hedgehog listed has died
with no date of death on record. The facility then acquired a hedgehog who gave birth and neither of those animals on on
the records. One ferret died with no date of death on record and a rabbit was also acquired with no corresponding
paperwork indicating where the animal came from. These records must be maintained in an accurate and timely manner
to reflect the collection at the facility. This needs to be addressed for the proper tracking of animal movement.
Correct by: Aug 31, 2023

The facility does not have a developed and documented plan that provides for the humane handling, treatment,
transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. This needs to be addressed
and a plan made available for APHIS personal for future inspections.
Correct by: Aug 31, 2023

There is a section of green cloth material that is covering the wire ramps in the guinea pig enclosure. One of the cloth
sections has been extensively chewed by the animals which could cause potential harm due to ingestion and impaction.
This cloth needs to be removed for the safety of the animals.
Correct by: Aug 16, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the animal curator.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The current records of animals on hand do not accurately reflect the animals at the facility. The hedgehog listed has died 
with no date of death on record. The facility then acquired a hedgehog who gave birth and neither of those animals on on 
the records. One ferret died with no date of death on record and a rabbit was also acquired with no corresponding 
paperwork indicating where the animal came from. These records must be maintained in an accurate and timely manner 
to reflect the collection at the facility. This needs to be addressed for the proper tracking of animal movement.  
Correct by: Aug 31, 2023 
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The facility does not have a developed and documented plan that provides for the humane handling, treatment, 
transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. This needs to be addressed 
and a plan made available for APHIS personal for future inspections.  
Correct by: Aug 31, 2023 
3.28(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
There is a section of green cloth material that is covering the wire ramps in the guinea pig enclosure. One of the cloth 
sections has been extensively chewed by the animals which could cause potential harm due to ingestion and impaction. 
This cloth needs to be removed for the safety of the animals. 
Correct by: Aug 16, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the animal curator. 
 
 n
